premises: Either human actions are determined or they are free but not both at the same time
conclusions: If human actions are not free, then they are determined
incorrect conclusions: If human actions are determined, then they are free
If human actions are free, then they are determined

premises: Either reality is subjective or it is objective but not both at the same time
conclusions: If reality is not objective, then it is subjective
incorrect conclusions: If reality is subjective, then it is objective
If reality is objective, then it is subjective

premises: Either knowledge is innate or it is acquired but not both at the same time
conclusions: If knowledge is not acquired, then it is innate
incorrect conclusions: If knowledge is innate, then it is acquired
If knowledge is acquired, then it is innate
